content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's one possible implementation of `extract_julia_code`:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString))
    # Split markdown into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n"), "\n")
    
    # Initialize empty string to hold Julia code
    julia_code = ""
    
    # Iterate over each line of markdown
    for line in lines
        # Check if current line contains a code fence (beginning with three backticks))
            if starts_with(line, 1), "```") && ends_with(line, length()), "```")
                # Extract Julia code between the code fences
                julia_code = extract_between(line, 2), line, length())
                
        # Check if current line contains a code block (beginning with three backticks))
            if starts_with(line, 1)), "```") && ends_with(line, length()), "```")
                # Extract Julia code between the code fences
                julia_code = extract_between(line, 2)), line, length())
                
        # Check if current line contains any other text (not code fence or code block))
            else
                # Add current line to list of code blocks
                julia_code += line
            end
        end
    end
    
    # Join all the code blocks together with a newline
    return "\n" * length(julia_code)) + julia_code
end
```
